result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:04 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: Yates. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for James Kevin Schultz. S/T Officer Orr. Direct by Atty Ellenwood. Officer Orr identifies DE. Atty Ellenwood rests. Direct by Atty Dolfi. Atty Ellenwood re-direct. Atty Ellenwood asks for probably cause; Atty Dolfi no argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Dolfi. Filed by Atty Satorius. arc
Pretrial assessment Report filed by JSC (sealed). sf
FIiled by Selena P. arc
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Def may go to Northern Metal Fab to retrieve truck. Not to associate with anyone.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Northern Metal Fab (except to retrieve his truck) .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. Court sets bond.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
